page.title: 09BATHEALTON
page.content: The landscape round Bathealton is very beautiful country land.It has lots of different types of wildlife e.g. badger,deer and many others.There are different woods and lanes which have a lot of history behind them.Stone Hill Lane winds up for three miles through a copse,it has a well just to the right and in 1959 it is believed that an old woman who lived up in the copse was pushed down the well or she could have thrown herself in ,no one will ever know.The coomn land is traditionally land that anybody can put their animals on to graze.But the land around Bathealton for about one and a half miles is very marshy and not very good for animals.The land is very nice to look at and you get a lovely view on a clear day.
